summary: heightened neuroplasticity allows the brain to reorganize and adapt to its environment. inflammation would putatively disrupt neuroplasticity. this work suggests inflammation during the childhood period could have unrecognized negative consequences. to model plasticity, we leveraged the paradigmatic ocular dominance model of in vivo developmental plasticity (Wiesel and Hubel, 1963) and generated transcriptional signatures from primary visual cortex (V1) to produce a diverse list of diseases ranked by their likelihood to dysregulate developmental plasticity. three to five animals per cage were group housed under a standard 12 h light/dark cycle. constant temperature (23°C) and ad libitum access to food and water. the institutional animal care and use committee approved all procedures involving animals. juvenile versus adult transcriptomes by first quantile normalizing probe-level data with limma. then computing rank-based differential expression with RankProd to yield 193 unique mouse Entrez IDs. we generated a Lynx1/ signature in an analogous manner to juvenile, to yield a 176 gene juvenile plasticity signature of 98 genes. a pathology score is the sum of the absolute value of the normalized disease signature gene expression that is shared with a hallmark gene set. a pathology score is the sum of the absolute value of the normalized disease signature gene expression that is shared with a hallmark gene set. negative values are pathological processes associated with diseases predicted to disrupt plasticity signatures. to calculate enrichments of top DLA gene sets, we chose a conservative cutoff of pcorrected 5 105. to calculate enrichments of top DLA gene sets, we chose a conservative cutoff of pcorrected 5 105. total RNA was extracted from V1 using the RNeasy Lipid Tissue Mini Kit (Qiagen) and stored at 80°C. RNA yields ranged from 4.5 to 10 g/sample and RNA integrity numbers ranged from 8.7 to 10 (mean, 9.8; SD, 0.32) total RNA was converted to cDNA using a High-Capacity cDNA Reverse Transcription Kit (Life Technologies) in vivo electrophysiology, the contralateral eye of experiment-naive P26 mice was sutured. the animal was immediately injected intraperitoneally with LPS. three days later, single-unit electrophysiological recordings were taken in binocular zone of V1 in response to visual stimuli presented to each eye separately. reversal of retinotopy seen as the electrode was moved into the secondary visual cortex. mice that experienced opening of the sutured eye or had poor recordings were excluded from further study. contralateral bias index (CBI) is a monocular weighted, animal-level summary statistic. a CBI value of 0.4 is ipsilateral dominant. for statistical comparison of ocular dominance, ODSs of single neurons were plotted as a proportion histogram and compared via a nonparametric 2 test. no specific p values reported, rather a group of genes under a specified p value threshold h Approximately normal Welch t test NA. no specific p values reported, rather a group of genes under a specified p value threshold h. plasticity signature generation Transcriptomes were profiled with microarray to generate plasticity signatures. a total of 4.5 g of cRNA was hybridized to Illumina WG-6 2.0 microarrays. a molecular matching score is the sum of the absolute value of the rank-difference gene expression measure of disease signatures. high scores indicate significant overlap between disease and plasticity signatures, whereas low scores indicate little or no overlap. the p value was chosen because the direction of effect for gene sets is not necessarily known. we calculated a linear regression between the pathology scores and disease–plasticity scores (the 1 coefficient) by computing 20,000 permutations of pathology scores using gene sets the same length as the input gene set. values are pathological processes associated with diseases that are predicted to not disrupt plasticity signatures. to calculate enrichments of top DLA gene sets, we chose a conservative cutoff of pcorrected 5 105 and then calculated the over-representation of inflammation gene sets among positive DLA associations. quantitative PCR core facility using TaqMan probes (catalog numbers: NogoR:00445861, Lynx1: 01204957_g1, S100a8: 00496696_g1, Lrg1: 01278767_m1, Lrg1: 01324470_m1, PirB: 01700366_m1, Cldn5: 00727012_s1, Egr2: 00456650_m1, Npas three days later, single-unit electrophysiological recordings were taken in binocular zone of V1 in response to visual stimuli presented to each eye separately. visually evoked single-unit responses were recorded with 16-channel silicone probes (NeuroNexus) the signal was amplified and thresholded (OmniPlex, Plexon) ODI is linearly transformed by assigning [1.0, 0.5) = 1, [0.5, 0.3) = 2, [0.3, 0.1) = 3, [0.1, +0.1] = 4, (+0.1, +0.3] = 5, (+0.3, +0.5] = 6, (+0.5, +1.0] = 7. contralateral bias index (CBI) is a monocular weighted, animal-level summary statistic. a and b are the successes and m and n are the totals (totals determined by dividing the successes by the published incidence rates) the influenza 95% confidence interval (CI) for the incidence rate ratio was estimated using the Katz log approach. no specific p values reported, rather a group of genes above a specified p value threshold (e.g., not significant) l Approximately normal welch t test, one-sided (due to specific prior hypothesis as to direction of effect; results still significant using a two-sided test. inflammatory bowel disease, metabolic diseases. a broad range of disease states may impact molecular pathways involved in plasticity. a, b, 176 genes (represented by green bars) were matched to 436 disease signatures.
